meanings.definition: A class of organic compounds containing a tetrazole ring.
meanings.sent1: Scientists study different tetrazoliums to understand their chemical structures.
meanings.sent2: The lab technician used tetrazoliums to analyze the new compound.
meanings.sent3: The tetrazoliums in the experiment were like colorful building blocks under the microscope.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a puzzle, each thought a vibrant tetrazolium waiting to be solved.
meanings.sent5: The textbook illustration made the concept of tetrazoliums crystal clear.

meanings.definition: A type of chemical reagent used in biological assays to detect metabolic activity.
meanings.sent1: The scientist added tetrazoliums to the solution to see if the cells were active.
meanings.sent2: Tetrazoliums are essential tools in studying cell metabolism.
meanings.sent3: The cells seemed to dance under the influence of the tetrazoliums, revealing their secrets.
meanings.sent4: In the lab, the tetrazoliums acted as detectives, uncovering the hidden metabolic clues.
meanings.sent5: The bright red color of the tetrazoliums indicated a high level of activity in the cells.

meanings.definition: A group of redox indicators commonly used in tissue staining techniques.
meanings.sent1: The biologist carefully applied the tetrazoliums to visualize the tissue structure.
meanings.sent2: Tetrazoliums help highlight specific areas of interest in the tissue sample.
meanings.sent3: The tissue looked like a colorful painting after the application of the tetrazoliums.
meanings.sent4: Under the microscope, the tetrazoliums revealed a hidden world within the tissue.
meanings.sent5: The vivid colors of the tetrazoliums made the tissue come alive in the experiment.
